Contributor: Wilson, W. N., artist.; Victory Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Signed "W.N. Wilson." Date of issue based on date of Victory Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: This advertisement is for display purposes only and will not appear in the newspaper. The text tells about James I. Mestrovitch, Sergeant, Co. C., 11th Infantry (Deceased). Sergeant Mestrovitch was honored for gallantry because he rescued his company commander who had been lying wounded in an unsheltered area.  The text then asks that you make your own personal sacrifice and subscribe to the Victory Liberty Loan. Illustration shows a depiction of the Sergeant carrying the officer on his back.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.

Title: America's immortals : James I. Mestrovitch.
